I forgot to say that I have max-trans-hops set to '3'. So that maybe why?.

If I lower the max-trans-hops to '1' I might get what I want because redirects and embeds "inside" my scope are already accepted by the 
OnDomainDecideRule.

But on the other hand - that means I have to move the TransculsionDecideRule right after the RejectDecideRule (before OnDomainDecideRule) to 
get only 1 hop of transclusion from out-of-scope URL's ?? or Does TransclusionDecideRule do PASS on URLs that are already accepted ??

best
Bjarne Andersen

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi.
> 
> With a basic DecideRule sequence it seems to me as redirects are always 
> fetched (including transitions and embeds from the resulting page)
> no matter the resulting page (the one that the redirect goes to) are 
> inside or outside of the ordinary scope.
> 
> Are there any way of defining a filter that only follows redirects if 
> the resulting page is also inside scope ??
> 
> My DecideRule Sequence is:
> RejectDecideRule
> OnDomainDecideRule
> TooManyHopsDecideRule
> PathologicalPathDecideRule
> TransclusionDecideRule
> TooManyPathSegmentsDecideRulePrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule
> 
> URLs that I do not want all have this Hoppath: RLRXE
> 
> I want the scoping and thus fetching to stop with the L - the second 
> redirect goes out of my scope.
> 
> best
> --
